Key Match Events: Aaron Ramsey nearly scored a header just over the bar
Joe Rodon spurned a close-range opportunity by spooning his effort over the bar
Sorba Thomas had a goal chalked off for offside
Baris Alper Yilmaz was sent off after a second yellow card
Harry Wilson bent an effort agonizingly off-target
Brennan Johnson swept wide at the near post
Abdulkerim Bardakci sent a header straight at Danny Ward
Pre-Game Insights: Craig Bellamy began his Wales reign with a goalless draw
Bellamy made just two changes to the side that hosted Turkey in November
Captain Aaron Ramsey started up front
Wales showed a fresh approach despite being expected to handle the same protagonists
Turkey struggled to get out of their own half due to a ferocious and dogged Wales press
Post-Match Reflections: Emotional reactions from players or coaches not mentioned
Craig Bellamy's attention to detail and passion for the job
Wales' performance was described as intense, frantic, and slick
Turkey's frustration increased as they were reduced to 10 men
Wales' performance deserved a breakthrough goal, but they couldn't find the net
Miscellaneous Highlights: Hen Wlad Fy Nhadau played before kick-off
Turkey's Vincenzo Montella booked for trouble with Baris Yilmaz
Hakan Calhanoglu was brought on as a substitute
Wales' Ollie Cooper and Jordan James made substitutions
